conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the ball when voltage is applied.
Ball falls vertically under gravity when no voltage is applied.
Electric field is created between plates when voltage is applied.
Electric field \( E \) is given by \( E = \frac{U}{d} \).
Ball moves along direction BC at a 45-degree angle when voltage is applied.
Electric force \( F_e \) must equal weight \( G \) and act horizontally.
Set up force balance: \( F_e = G \) and \( F_e = qE \).
Charge amount of the ball is \( \boxed{\frac{Gd}{U}} \).
